options.name: Option A: Bell Nozzle Redesign
options.description: Replace conical nozzle with Rao-optimized bell nozzle (15° initial, 8° final)
pros: Maintains 100:1 expansion ratio and 410 s Isp
cons: Still exceeds 150 mm requirement (184 mm)
Higher manufacturing complexity
More difficult to fabricate than conical
Additional tooling costs

options.name: Option B1: Reduced Expansion Ratio (60:1, conical)
options.description: Reduce expansion ratio from 100:1 to 60:1 with conical nozzle, increase chamber pressure to maintain thrust
pros: Isp = 344 s (56% margin above 220 s requirement)
cons: Still exceeds 150 mm (178 mm)
Requires chamber pressure exceeding feed limit (0.25 MPa > 0.21 MPa max)
Isp reduced from 410 s to 344 s (16% reduction)
Not feasible with current feed system pressure

options.name: Option B2: Reduced Expansion Ratio (80:1, conical)
options.description: Reduce expansion ratio from 100:1 to 80:1 with conical nozzle, increase chamber pressure to maintain thrust
cons: Still exceeds 150 mm (194 mm, longer than 100:1!)
Requires chamber pressure exceeding feed limit (0.228 MPa > 0.21 MPa max)
Isp reduced from 410 s to 378 s (8% reduction)
Not feasible with current feed system pressure

options.name: Option B3: Reduced Expansion Ratio (60:1, bell)
options.description: Reduce expansion ratio to 60:1 AND use bell nozzle, increase chamber pressure to maintain thrust
pros: Reduced divergence losses from bell nozzle
cons: Still exceeds 150 mm (159 mm, 8.8 mm overage)
Requires chamber pressure exceeding feed limit (0.25 MPa > 0.21 MPa max)
Isp reduced from 410 s to 344 s (16% reduction)
Higher manufacturing complexity (bell nozzle)
Not feasible with current feed system pressure

options.name: Option B4: Reduced Expansion Ratio (50:1, bell)
options.description: Reduce expansion ratio to 50:1 with bell nozzle for margin, increase chamber pressure to maintain thrust
pros: Length = 151 mm (1.3 mm over 150 mm requirement)
cons: Still exceeds 150 mm (151 mm)
Requires chamber pressure exceeding feed limit (0.265 MPa > 0.21 MPa max)
Largest Isp reduction (21% to 324 s)
Higher propellant consumption
Not feasible with current feed system pressure

options.name: Option C: Requirement Relaxation
options.description: Relax REQ-012 length limit from 150 mm to 210 mm
pros: Maximizes mission life with highest Isp
cons: Requires requirements owner approval (Agent 1)
Longer thruster affects spacecraft integration
Potential impact on spacecraft layout
Vehicle integration constraints must be verified
